Open Source and Reproducible MIR Research
About

About

This is the webpage for the Open Source and Reproducible MIR Research tutorial, run by Brian McFee and Thor Kell at ISMIR 2018 in Paris, France.

The goal of the tutorial is to provide hands-on, practical training for MIR researchers to learn modern tools for improving the quality of their research software - version control, testing, test automation, and so on.

You can follow the tutorial by working through each part, starting with Part 1 and ending with Part 8.

If youâ€™d like to run this tutorial, or base your own work off of it, you can find the source for this webpage on GitHub. Our slides can also be found here, and are licensed CC BY-SA.

Thanks!
